original: @119b / /rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @119b / /rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: a'arya dharma mu dr'a n'a ma mah'a y'a na s'u tra /
analyzed: a'arya dharma mu dr'a n'a ma mah'a y'a na s'u tra /
translated: Ārya-dharma-mudrā-nāma-mahāyāna-sūtra

original: bod skad du /🔽'phags pa chos kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba theg @120a *//
analyzed: bod skad du / 'phags pa chos kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba theg @120a *//
translated: In Tibetan:

original: pa chen po'i mdo /
analyzed: pa chen po'i mdo /
translated: The Noble Great Vehicle Sūtra called The Dharma Seal

original: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas.

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa dus gcig na /
translated: Thus have I heard at one time.

original: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na /
translated: The Blessed One was dwelling in Śrāvastī, in Jeta's Grove, in Anāthapiṇḍada's park,

original: dge slong lnga stong tha ma pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rab tu mang po dag dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs te /
analyzed: dge slong lnga stong tha ma pa'i dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rab tu mang po dag dang thabs gcig tu bzhugs te /
translated: together with a great saṅgha of monks, five thousand in number, and with a multitude of bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bcom ldan 'das kyi mthus stan las langs te /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu bcom ldan 'das kyi mthus stan las langs te /
translated: Then, through the power of the Blessed One, the Venerable Śāriputra rose from his seat,

original: bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
analyzed: bla gos phrag pa gcig tu gzar nas pus mo g-yas pa'i lha nga sa la btsugs te /
translated: put his upper robe over one shoulder, and knelt on his right knee.

original: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar ba btud nas /
translated: He bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined.🔽

original: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la 'di skad ces gsol to //
translated: He bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined and said:

original: bcom ldan 'das rab tu byung ba rab tu byung ba zhes bgyi na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das rab tu byung ba rab tu byung ba zhes bgyi na /
translated: “Blessed One, when it is said that someone is a renunciate, a renunciate,

original: bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Blessed One,

original: ji tsam gyis na legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la dge slong rab tu byung ba 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdzogs par bsnyen pas rdzogs par bsnyen pa lags /
analyzed: ji tsam gyis na legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la dge slong rab tu byung ba 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdzogs par bsnyen pas rdzogs par bsnyen pa lags /
translated: to what extent is a monk who has gone forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya fully ordained through the ārya supramundane ordination?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams las kyang ma 'das la /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams las kyang ma 'das la /
translated: to the extent that one has not transcended the qualities of an ordinary being

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang ma thob pa de tsam gyis na dge slong legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i @120b pa'i rdzogs par bsnyen pas rdzogs par bsnyen pa yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang ma thob pa de tsam gyis na dge slong legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i @120b pa'i rdzogs par bsnyen pas rdzogs par bsnyen pa yin te /
translated: and has not attained the uncontaminated qualities, to that extent a monk who has gone forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya is fully ordained through the ārya supramundane ordination.

original: de ltar rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni yang dag par rab tu byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni yang dag par rab tu byung ba yin gyi /
translated: Those who go forth in this way are truly gone forth.

original: de lta ma yin par rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni log par rab tu byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin par rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni log par rab tu byung ba yin no //
translated: Those who go forth in any other way are falsely gone forth.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: dge slong de lta bus ni dad pas byin pa longs spyod par 'os te /
analyzed: dge slong de lta bus ni dad pas byin pa longs spyod par 'os te /
translated: monks like that are worthy of receiving the offerings of the faithful.

original: gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / sman zong rnams longs spyad par 'os so //
analyzed: gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / sman zong rnams longs spyad par 'os so //
translated: They are worthy of receiving robes, food, bedding, seats, medicine, and healing substances.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: gzhan yang brtson pa mi gtong ba'i dge slong gang yin pa de ni gzugs gtong bar mi byed /
analyzed: gzhan yang brtson pa mi gtong ba'i dge slong gang yin pa de ni gzugs gtong bar mi byed /
translated: monks who do not abandon diligence do not abandon form.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gtong bar mi byed de /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gtong bar mi byed de /
translated: They do not abandon feelings, perceptions, formative predispositions, or consciousness.

original: de tsam gyi ni dge slong legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdzogs par bsnyen pas rdzogs par bsnyen pa yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyi ni dge slong legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdzogs par bsnyen pas rdzogs par bsnyen pa yin te /
translated: A monk who is just like that is one who has gone forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya, and is one who has been fully ordained in the noble, super-worldly system of ordination.

original: de ltar rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni yang dag par rab tu byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni yang dag par rab tu byung ba yin gyi /
translated: Those who have gone forth in this way are those who have gone forth in the right way.

original: de lta ma yin par rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni log par rab tu byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin par rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni log par rab tu byung ba yin no //
translated: Those who have gone forth in a way that is not like this are those who have gone forth in the wrong way.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: dge slong de lta bus ni dad pas byin pa longs spyad par 'os te /
analyzed: dge slong de lta bus ni dad pas byin pa longs spyad par 'os te /
translated: monks who are like this are worthy to enjoy the offerings of the faithful.

original: gos dang zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / sman zong rnams longs spyad par 'os so //
analyzed: gos dang zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / sman zong rnams longs spyad par 'os so //
translated: They are worthy to enjoy the robes, food, bedding, seats, remedies for sickness, and medicine that are given in charity.🔽Then the venerable Subhūti said to the venerable Śāriputra:

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces @121a *//🔽smras so // tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces @121a *//🔽smras so // tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi ci la dgongs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi ci la dgongs te /
translated: What did the Bhagavān have in mind

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams las kyang ma 'das la /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams las kyang ma 'das la /
translated: when he said, ‘They have not transcended the qualities of ordinary beings,🔽but they have not attained the qualities that are free of defilements’?

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang ma thob pa de tsam gyis na dge slong legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdzogs par bsnyen pas rdzogs par bsnyen pa yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang ma thob pa de tsam gyis na dge slong legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdzogs par bsnyen pas rdzogs par bsnyen pa yin te /
translated: Bhikṣus who have gone forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya are fully ordained through the Āryan, supramundane, and complete ordination.

original: de ltar rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni yang dag par rab tu byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni yang dag par rab tu byung ba yin gyi /
translated: Those who have gone forth in that way are truly gone forth.

original: de lta ma yin par rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni log par rab tu byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin par rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni log par rab tu byung ba yin no //
translated: Those who have gone forth in any other way are falsely gone forth.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: dge slong de lta bus ni dad pas byin pa longs spyad par 'os te /
analyzed: dge slong de lta bus ni dad pas byin pa longs spyad par 'os te /
translated: bhikṣus of that kind are worthy to enjoy the offerings of the faithful.

original: gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / sman zong rnams longs spyod par 'os so zhes de skad bka' stsal /
analyzed: gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / sman zong rnams longs spyod par 'os so zhes de skad bka' stsal /
translated: They are worthy to enjoy clothing, food, bedding, seats, medicine, and healing substances.”

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: “Venerable Subhūti,

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams ni sgyu ma lta bu ste /
translated: the qualities of ordinary beings are like an illusion.

original: de dag ni 'da' bar bya bar mi nus so //
analyzed: de dag ni 'da' bar bya bar mi nus so //
translated: They cannot be transcended.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams ni yongs su ma grub pa ste /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams ni yongs su ma grub pa ste /
translated: the qualities of ordinary beings are not fully accomplished.

original: de dag ni 'da' bar bya bar sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni 'da' bar bya bar sla ba ma yin no //
translated: They are not easily transcended.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: sems can gyi khams ni nang na'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: sems can gyi khams ni nang na'ang mi dmigs /
translated: the realm of sentient beings is not apprehended internally,

original: phyi rol na'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang mi dmigs /
translated: it is not apprehended externally,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs te /
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs te /
translated: and it is not apprehended apart from both.

original: sems can gyi khams kyi rang bzhin gang @121b yin pa dang / so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de dag ni 'da' bar bya bar sla ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can gyi khams kyi rang bzhin gang @121b yin pa dang / so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams kyi rang bzhin gang yin pa de dag ni 'da' bar bya bar sla ba ma yin no //
translated: The nature of the realm of sentient beings and the nature of the qualities of ordinary beings are not easily transcended.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor / bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: the Blessed One has said,🔽‘The qualities of ordinary beings are not transcended,

original: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams las kyang ma 'das la /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams las kyang ma 'das la /
translated: and yet

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang ma thob pa de tsam gyis na /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang ma thob pa de tsam gyis na /
translated: And also, the uncontaminated dharmas are not obtained.

original: dge slong legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba 'phags pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdzogs par bsnyen pas rdzogs par bsnyen pa yin te /
analyzed: dge slong legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba 'phags pa'i 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdzogs par bsnyen pas rdzogs par bsnyen pa yin te /
translated: The monk who has gone forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya is fully ordained through the noble supramundane higher ordination.

original: de ltar rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni yang dag par rab tu byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni yang dag par rab tu byung ba yin gyi /
translated: Those who have gone forth in that way are truly gone forth.

original: de lta ma yin par rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni log par rab tu byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin par rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni log par rab tu byung ba yin no //
translated: Those who have gone forth in a way that is not like that are falsely gone forth.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: dge slong de lta bu ni dad pas byin pa longs spyod par 'os te /
analyzed: dge slong de lta bu ni dad pas byin pa longs spyod par 'os te /
translated: a monk like that is worthy to enjoy what is given in faith.

original: gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / sman zong rnams longs spyod par 'os so zhes gang gsungs pa de'ang /
analyzed: gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / sman zong rnams longs spyod par 'os so zhes gang gsungs pa de'ang /
translated: He is worthy to enjoy clothing, food, bedding, seats, medicine for curing the sick, and supplies for the sick.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: gang dag gi rten nam /
analyzed: gang dag gi rten nam /
translated: what is the basis of that?

original: gnas med pa de dag ni ji ltar thob par rung /
analyzed: gnas med pa de dag ni ji ltar thob par rung /
translated: How could they be attained?

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: gal te zag pa med pa'i chos rnams thob tu rung na ni dmigs pa las dgra bcom pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te zag pa med pa'i chos rnams thob tu rung na ni dmigs pa las dgra bcom pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: if uncontaminated phenomena could be attained, then an arhat would arise from an object.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos nyid ni ltos pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos nyid ni ltos pa med pa ste /
translated: The reality of the tathāgatas, arhats, perfectly complete buddhas is independent.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la dgongs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la dgongs nas /
translated: the Blessed One had that in mind

original: 'di skad du /🔽so so'i @122a *//
analyzed: 'di skad du / so so'i @122a *//
translated: when he said,

original: skye bo'i chos rnams las kyang ma 'das la /
analyzed: skye bo'i chos rnams las kyang ma 'das la /
translated: ‘They do not transcend the qualities of ordinary beings,🔽and they do not attain uncontaminated qualities.

original: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang ma thob pa de tsam gyis na dge slong legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdzogs par bsnyen pas rdzogs par bsnyen pa yin te /
analyzed: zag pa med pa'i chos rnams kyang ma thob pa de tsam gyis na dge slong legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdzogs par bsnyen pas rdzogs par bsnyen pa yin te /
translated: To that extent, a monk who has gone forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya, who has completed the noble and supramundane ordination,

original: de ltar rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni yang dag par rab tu byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni yang dag par rab tu byung ba yin gyi /
translated: Those who are renunciants in this way are true renunciants.

original: de ltar ma yin pa rab tu byung ba gang yin pa de dag ni log par rab tu byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ma yin pa rab tu byung ba gang yin pa de dag ni log par rab tu byung ba yin no //
translated: Those who are renunciants in any other way are false renunciants.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: dge slong de lta bus ni dad pas byin pa la longs spyad par 'os te /
analyzed: dge slong de lta bus ni dad pas byin pa la longs spyad par 'os te /
translated: monks like that are worthy to enjoy the offerings of the faithful.

original: gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / sman zong rnams longs spyod par 'os so zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / sman zong rnams longs spyod par 'os so zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: They are worthy to enjoy clothing, food, bedding, seats, medicine, and healing substances.”

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis yang tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor gyis yang tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the venerable Subhūti said to the venerable Śāriputra,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Venerable Śāriputra,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis ci la dgongs te brtson pa mi gtong ba'i dge slong gang yin pa de ni gzugs gtong bar mi byed /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis ci la dgongs te brtson pa mi gtong ba'i dge slong gang yin pa de ni gzugs gtong bar mi byed /
translated: what do you think? What was the Blessed One thinking when he said, ‘Monks who do not give up striving do not give up form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gtong bar mi byed de /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gtong bar mi byed de /
translated: He does not give up form, feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: de tsam gyis na dge slong legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba las rab tu byung ba 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdzogs par bsnyen pas rdzogs par bsnyen pa yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis na dge slong legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba las rab tu byung ba 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdzogs par bsnyen pas rdzogs par bsnyen pa yin te /
translated: To that extent, a monk who has gone forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya is fully ordained through the Āryan, supramundane, complete going forth.

original: de ltar rab tu byung ba @122b gang dag yin pa de dag ni yang dag par rab tu byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu byung ba @122b gang dag yin pa de dag ni yang dag par rab tu byung ba yin gyi /
translated: Those who have gone forth in that way are truly gone forth.

original: de lta ma yin par rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni log par rab tu byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin par rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni log par rab tu byung ba yin no //
translated: Those who have gone forth in a way that is not like that are falsely gone forth.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: dge slong de lta bus ni dad pas byin pa longs spyod par 'os te /
analyzed: dge slong de lta bus ni dad pas byin pa longs spyod par 'os te /
translated: monks like that are worthy to enjoy what is given in faith.

original: gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / sman zong rnams longs spyod par 'os so zhes de skad bka' stsal /
analyzed: gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / sman zong rnams longs spyod par 'os so zhes de skad bka' stsal /
translated: They are worthy to enjoy robes, food, bedding, seats, medicine for curing the sick, and monastic requisites.”

original: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bus smras pa /
translated: Śāriputra said,🔽“Excellent, excellent, Venerable Subhūti!

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos nyid las dgongs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis chos nyid las dgongs nas /
translated: the Blessed One, with the intention of the nature of phenomena,

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: has said this:

original: brtson pa mi gtong ba'i dge slong gang yin pa de ni gzugs gtong bar mi byed /
analyzed: brtson pa mi gtong ba'i dge slong gang yin pa de ni gzugs gtong bar mi byed /
translated: “Monks who do not abandon diligence do not abandon form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gtong bar mi byed ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gtong bar mi byed ces bka' stsal to //
translated: and do not abandon feeling, perception, formation, or consciousness.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: chos kyi dbyings na ni nang na'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings na ni nang na'ang mi dmigs /
translated: in the realm of phenomena, the inner is not apprehended,

original: phyi rol na'ang mi dmigs /
analyzed: phyi rol na'ang mi dmigs /
translated: the outer is not apprehended,

original: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gnyis ka med par yang mi dmigs so //
translated: and the neither is apprehended.

original: nang gdags pa ni gdags su med pa dang / skye ba med pa'i gdags pa'o; ;de ltar na sems can gyi khams mnyam pa nyid kyis chos kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: nang gdags pa ni gdags su med pa dang / skye ba med pa'i gdags pa'o; ;de ltar na sems can gyi khams mnyam pa nyid kyis chos kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The designation of the inner is the designation of the unapprehendable and the unborn. Thus, the realm of sentient beings is sameness through the sameness of the realm of phenomena.

original: chos kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid kyis sems can gyi khams mnyam pa nyid do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings mnyam pa nyid kyis sems can gyi khams mnyam pa nyid do //
translated: The realm of phenomena is sameness through the sameness of the realm of sentient beings.

original: de ltar na sems can gyi khams dang chos kyi dbyings 'di ni gnyis su med de gnyis su dbyer med do //🔽gang la gnyis su med pa de gnyis su dbyer med pa de la ni gsal ba'ang med /🔽gzhag @123a *// pa'ang med do //
analyzed: de ltar na sems can gyi khams dang chos kyi dbyings 'di ni gnyis su med de gnyis su dbyer med do // gang la gnyis su med pa de gnyis su dbyer med pa de la ni gsal ba'ang med / gzhag @123a *// pa'ang med do //
translated: Thus, the realm of sentient beings and the dharma-constituent are non-dual; they are not divided into two.🔽In that which is non-dual, there is no division into two.

original: gang la gsal ba'ang med /🔽gzhag pa'ang med pa de ni 'das pa'am /
analyzed: gang la gsal ba'ang med / gzhag pa'ang med pa de ni 'das pa'am /
translated: In that which is non-dual, there is no clarification and no establishment.🔽In that which is non-dual, there is no clarification and no establishment.

original: 'thob par byar mi nus te /
analyzed: 'thob par byar mi nus te /
translated: That which is non-dual cannot be clarified or established.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la dgongs nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la dgongs nas /
translated: the Lord had this in mind

original: 'di skad du /
analyzed: 'di skad du /
translated: when he said,

original: brtson pa mi gtong ba'i dge slong gang yin pa de ni gzugs gtong bar mi byed /
analyzed: brtson pa mi gtong ba'i dge slong gang yin pa de ni gzugs gtong bar mi byed /
translated: ‘The monk who does not give up striving does not give up form,

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gtong bar mi byed de /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa gtong bar mi byed de /
translated: does not give up feeling, perception, volitional factors, or consciousness.

original: de tsam gyis na dge slong legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdzogs par bsnyen pas rdzogs par bsnyen pa yin te /
analyzed: de tsam gyis na dge slong legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdzogs par bsnyen pas rdzogs par bsnyen pa yin te /
translated: “Monks who are like this are fully ordained through the noble, supramundane, complete going forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

original: de ltar rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni yang dag par rab tu byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni yang dag par rab tu byung ba yin gyi /
translated: Those who have gone forth like this are truly gone forth.

original: de lta ma yin par rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni log par rab tu byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin par rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni log par rab tu byung ba yin no //
translated: Those who have gone forth in a way that is not like this are falsely gone forth.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: dge slong de lta bus ni dad pas byin pa longs spyad par 'os te /
analyzed: dge slong de lta bus ni dad pas byin pa longs spyad par 'os te /
translated: monks like this are worthy to enjoy what is given in faith.

original: gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / sman zong rnams longs spyad par 'os so zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / sman zong rnams longs spyad par 'os so zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: They are worthy to enjoy clothing, food, bedding, seats, and medicines for curing the sick.

original: dogs pa med pa'i dge slong ni dogs pa khas mi len to //
analyzed: dogs pa med pa'i dge slong ni dogs pa khas mi len to //
translated: Monks who are free from doubts do not accept doubts.

original: yi ge med cing yi ge las 'das pa'i dge slong gang yin pa de ni bgrang ba las bstan par mi nus la de la ni 'ong ba'ang med /
analyzed: yi ge med cing yi ge las 'das pa'i dge slong gang yin pa de ni bgrang ba las bstan par mi nus la de la ni 'ong ba'ang med /
translated: The monk who is beyond letters and beyond the written word cannot be taught by counting. He has no coming,

original: 'gro ba'ang med /🔽'greng ba'ang med /🔽'dug pa'ang med /
analyzed: 'gro ba'ang med / 'greng ba'ang med / 'dug pa'ang med /
translated: no going,🔽no standing,🔽no sitting,

original: nyal ba'ang med do //
analyzed: nyal ba'ang med do //
translated: and no lying down.

original: @123b rtog pa can ma yin pa'i dge slong ni brtags pa la longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: @123b rtog pa can ma yin pa'i dge slong ni brtags pa la longs spyod pa'o //
translated: The monk who is not a thinker enjoys the examined.

original: rtog pa can gyi dge slong ni ma brtags pa la longs spyod pa ste /
analyzed: rtog pa can gyi dge slong ni ma brtags pa la longs spyod pa ste /
translated: The monk who is a thinker enjoys the unexamined.

original: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa rab 'byor /
translated: Venerable Subhūti,

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la dgongs nas de tsam gyis na dge slong legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdzogs par bsnyen pas rdzogs par bsnyen pa yin te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la dgongs nas de tsam gyis na dge slong legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba 'phags pa 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rdzogs par bsnyen pas rdzogs par bsnyen pa yin te /
translated: the Blessed One had this in mind when he said, ‘A monk who has gone forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya is fully ordained through the noble, supramundane, complete ordination.

original: de ltar rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni yang dag par rab tu byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni yang dag par rab tu byung ba yin gyi /
translated: Those who have gone forth in this way are truly gone forth.

original: de lta ma yin par rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni log par rab tu byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta ma yin par rab tu byung ba gang dag yin pa de dag ni log par rab tu byung ba yin no //
translated: Those who are not like that are falsely ordained.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: dge slong de lta bus ni dad pas byin pa longs spyad par 'os te /
analyzed: dge slong de lta bus ni dad pas byin pa longs spyad par 'os te /
translated: those bhikṣus are worthy to enjoy the offerings of the faithful,

original: gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / sman zong rnams longs spyad par 'os so zhes bka' stsal to //
analyzed: gos dang / zas dang / mal cha dang / stan dang / na ba'i gsos sman dang / sman zong rnams longs spyad par 'os so zhes bka' stsal to //
translated: and are worthy to enjoy the robes, alms, bedding and seats, and medicines for the sick provided by the faithful.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la legs so zhes bya ba byin te /🔽sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu la legs so zhes bya ba byin te / sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Then the Bhagavān said to the venerable Śāriputra, “Excellent, Śāriputra!

original: legs so // legs so //
analyzed: legs so // legs so //
translated: Excellent, Śāriputra!

original: khyod kyis ji skad bstan pa bzhin du ngas de las dgongs nas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: khyod kyis ji skad bstan pa bzhin du ngas de las dgongs nas bstan pa yin te /
translated: I have taught with that very meaning in mind what you have taught.

original: 'di ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ba yin no //
translated: This is the going forth in the well-taught Dharma and Vinaya.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: phyag rgya 'dris mngon pa'i  nga rgyal can brtag par 'dod pas ni phyag rgya de'i mdun du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya 'dris mngon pa'i  nga rgyal can brtag par 'dod pas ni phyag rgya de'i mdun du brjod par bya'o //
translated: those who wish to examine the pride of those who are familiar with the seal should recite this seal in their presence.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: shin tu brtag pa ni phyag rgya 'dis ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal can mang po brtag par nus @124a *//
analyzed: shin tu brtag pa ni phyag rgya 'dis ni mngon pa'i nga rgyal can mang po brtag par nus @124a *//
translated: this seal can be used to examine the many who are arrogant.

original: so; ;chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bstan pa na dge slong bdun brgya len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: so; ;chos kyi rnam grangs 'di bstan pa na dge slong bdun brgya len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: When this Dharma discourse was taught, the minds of seven hundred monks were liberated from defilements without further appropriation.

original: srid pa tha ma pa'i dge slong brgya ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la ma zhugs shing ma rtogs la ma mos nas stan las langs te dong ngo //
analyzed: srid pa tha ma pa'i dge slong brgya ni chos kyi rnam grangs 'di la ma zhugs shing ma rtogs la ma mos nas stan las langs te dong ngo //
translated: One hundred monks who had reached their final existence, however, did not understand, did not accept, and did not have faith in this Dharma discourse. They rose from their seats and left.

original: dge slong lnga ni spong bar byas shing bzlog par byas nas rang gi lus dang bcas te sems can dmyal ba chen por lhung ngo //
analyzed: dge slong lnga ni spong bar byas shing bzlog par byas nas rang gi lus dang bcas te sems can dmyal ba chen por lhung ngo //
translated: Five monks, having rejected and turned away from this Dharma discourse, fell into the great hells together with their bodies.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: ngas kye ma chos 'di ni 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun no snyam ste /
analyzed: ngas kye ma chos 'di ni 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun no snyam ste /
translated: I thought, 'Alas, this Dharma is not in accord with the whole world.'

original: de la dgongs nas de skad bstan mod kyi 'on kyang gang dang yang mi mthun pa med de /
analyzed: de la dgongs nas de skad bstan mod kyi 'on kyang gang dang yang mi mthun pa med de /
translated: With that in mind, I taught in that way. However, it is not in disagreement with anything.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: dper na / mi la la zhig gnyid kyis log pa'i rmi lam du skye bo phal po che'i mdun du khyod la ngas chos bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na / mi la la zhig gnyid kyis log pa'i rmi lam du skye bo phal po che'i mdun du khyod la ngas chos bshad par bya'o //
translated: it is like this: Suppose a man, while asleep, in a dream, in front of a great crowd of people, were to say, ‘I will teach you the Dharma!

original: chos de'ang 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun no zhes tshig tu smra na /
analyzed: chos de'ang 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun no zhes tshig tu smra na /
translated: And that Dharma is not in accord with anything in the world.’

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems /
translated: what do you think about this?

original: chos de dang mi mthun pa gang dag yin pa'i mi de dag yod pa yin nam /
analyzed: chos de dang mi mthun pa gang dag yin pa'i mi de dag yod pa yin nam /
translated: Are there any people who are not in accord with that Dharma?”

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: Śāriputra replied, “Bhagavān,

original: de ni ma mchis lags so //
analyzed: de ni ma mchis lags so //
translated: there are none.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Bhagavān said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin du nga'ang kye ma chos 'di ni 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun no zhes de skad du'ang ston la de 'jig rten de'ang yang dag par ma @124b mthong ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du nga'ang kye ma chos 'di ni 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun no zhes de skad du'ang ston la de 'jig rten de'ang yang dag par ma @124b mthong ngo //
translated: in the same way, I also teach, saying, ‘Alas, this Dharma is not in accord with anything in the world.’ But the world does not see that world correctly.

original: 'jig rten med pa la ni chos kyang bgrang du med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten med pa la ni chos kyang bgrang du med do //
translated: Where there is no world, there is no counting of dharmas.

original: 'jig rten gdags pa'ang med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gdags pa'ang med do //
translated: There is no designation of a world.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams ma 'dres shing chos rnams 'dre pa med pa la bya bar gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten thams cad dang mi mthun pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams ma 'dres shing chos rnams 'dre pa med pa la bya bar gsungs so //
translated: “Not in accord with the world” means that phenomena are not mixed up, that phenomena are not confused.🔽Śāriputra said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: ma 'dres pa zhes bgyi ba'i tshig gi don gang lags /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa zhes bgyi ba'i tshig gi don gang lags /
translated: what is the meaning of the words ‘not mixed up’?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu; ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams ro gcig par gdags pa yin te /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu; ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba ni chos rnams ro gcig par gdags pa yin te /
translated: “Śāriputra, ‘not mixed up’ means that phenomena are designated as having one taste.

original: gcig pu kho na'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig pu kho na'ang ma yin te /
translated: They are not just one,

original: tha dad pa kho na'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa kho na'ang ma yin no //
translated: nor are they just different.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba de ni stong pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa zhes bya ba de ni stong pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags so //
translated: ‘not mixed up’ is a synonym for emptiness.”🔽Śāriputra said,

original: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: gsol pa / bcom ldan 'das /
translated: “Blessed One,

original: stong pa nyid ces bgyi ba'i tshig gi don gang lags /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ces bgyi ba'i tshig gi don gang lags /
translated: what is the meaning of the words ‘emptiness’?”

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni gdags su med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid ces bya ba ni gdags su med pa'o //
translated: ‘emptiness’ means that there is no designation.

original: gang gdags su med pa de ni gdags par mi nus so //
analyzed: gang gdags su med pa de ni gdags par mi nus so //
translated: What cannot be designated cannot be designated.”

original: gang gdags par mi nus pa de ni 'jig rten pa'ang ma yin /
analyzed: gang gdags par mi nus pa de ni 'jig rten pa'ang ma yin /
translated: That which cannot be designated is neither worldly nor

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang ma yin no; ;sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang ma yin no; ;sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: beyond the world.

original: gang 'jig rten pa  ma yin 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang ma yin pa de ni stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten pa  ma yin 'jig rten las 'das pa'ang ma yin pa de ni stong pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: Śāriputra, that which is neither worldly nor beyond the world is called emptiness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad ces bka' stsal nas /
translated: When the Bhagavān had spoken these words,

original: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas @125a *//🔽pa'i 'jig rten yi rangs te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sh'a ri'i bu dang / dge slong gi dge 'dun thams cad dang / byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po de dag dang / lha dang / mi dang / lha ma yin dang / dri zar bcas @125a *// pa'i 'jig rten yi rangs te /
translated: the venerable Śāriputra, the entire saṅgha of monks, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas, and the world with its gods, humans, asuras, and gandharvas

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa la mngon par bstod do //
translated: rejoiced and praised the Bhagavān’s words.🔽This concludes the noble Great Vehicle sūtra “The Seal of Dharma.”

original: 'phags pa chos kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo rdzogs so;; ;;lo ts'a ba bande klu'i dbang po dang / lha'i zla bas bsgyur cing gtan la phab pa //
analyzed: 'phags pa chos kyi phyag rgya zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo rdzogs so;; ;;lo ts'a ba bande klu'i dbang po dang / lha'i zla bas bsgyur cing gtan la phab pa //
translated: It was translated and finalized by the Indian preceptors Jinamitra and Dānaśīla, and the chief editor-translator Bandé Yeshé Dé.
